image.title: World News Today, Trending World News, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: Matt Gaetz, Trump's attorney general pick, accused of participating in 10 sex parties
item.description: Lawyer Joel Leppard representing two women who already testified before the House Ethics Committee said his clients informed the probe panel that drugs were consumed at those sex parties. One of the women claimed to have seen Gaetz having sex with an underage friend up against a games table. Leppard said he will make media appearances revealing details of those orgies so that the committee releases the report.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: What! 'Morning Joe' hosts visit Trump at Mar-a-Lago: 'We are not here to normalize him'
item.description: Morning Joe co-hosts Joe Scarborough and Mika Brzezinski made their shocking announcement that they met with former President Donald Trump at Mar-a-Lago, marking their first encounter in seven years. It was a patch-up meeting as the hosts said they wanted to restart communications but faced massive outrage on social media. Morning Joe is dead, users wrote on X after today's Morning Joe.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Who is Yasir Al-Rumayyan, the 'mystery man' sitting beside Trump at UFC fight?
item.description: The man, termed as the 'mystery man' in some of the videos doing rounds on social media, was Yasir Al-Rumayyan, the head of Saudi Arabia's Public Investment Fund, Fox News reported. Al-Rumayyan also chairs Saudi Aramco and the English Premier's Newcastle United Football Club. The Washington Post reported that Trump met key Saydi figures in recent days. He played a round of golf with PGA Tour commissioner Jay Monahan on Friday.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: As Ann Selzer exits election polling, Donald Trump says 'she knew exactly what she was doing'
item.description: As Ann Selzer announced that she would not be doing polling for election any more after her wrong prediction in Iowa that kept Kamala Harris ahead of Donald Trump, President-elect Trump said there should be an investigation into her polling that 'caused great distrust and uncertainty at a very critical time'. Trump said she Ann Selzer knew exactly what she was doing.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Apollo, the stray dog scaling Egypt’s pyramids, becomes viral sensation
item.description: Apollo, a stray dog living at the Giza Pyramids, became an overnight sensation after a video of him scaling the Great Pyramid of Khafre went viral. His newfound fame has not only boosted local tourism but also brought attention to the plight of stray animals in Egypt.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Gabon votes 'yes' to new constitution
Germany approves more professional visas amid labour shortage
item.description: Germany is on track to issue 10% more skilled worker visas in 2024 compared to the previous year. This follows immigration reforms, including the introduction of a points-based system, aimed at addressing labour shortages. The reforms have sparked interest from professionals and students worldwide, with a significant increase in visa applications for work, study, and qualification recognition.

item.title: Germany to enforce strict knife ban at Christmas markets
item.description: Germany is increasing security at its Christmas markets this year, enforcing a new ban on sharp weapons following a deadly knife attack in August. Interior Minister Nancy Faeser emphasized 'zero tolerance' for violations, which could result in fines up to €10,000. The ban, part of a larger security package, prohibits knives at large public gatherings.

item.title: Senegal ruling party claims victory in legislative elections
item.description: Senegal's ruling PASTEF party, led by President Bassirou Diomaye Faye, has declared victory in the legislative elections. The win solidifies Faye's power after his presidential victory earlier this year. Opposition parties conceded defeat, while former President Macky Sall, leading an opposition group from abroad, alleged fraud without providing evidence.

item.title: Mini cars, big thrills: Forget cheese, rats have need for speed
item.description: Neuroscientist Kelly Lambert and her team at the University of Richmond discovered that rats not only can learn to drive small vehicles but also exhibit genuine enjoyment in the process. The rats, trained using Froot Loops as rewards, displayed excitement and anticipation before driving sessions, suggesting a positive emotional response to operating the vehicles.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Life be damned': Donald Trump Jr accuses Joe Biden of triggering 'World War III' over US missiles being used by Ukraine
item.description: Donald Trump Jr alleged that the Biden administration's decision to allow Ukraine to use US missiles within Russia aims to provoke a global conflict before his father, Donald Trump, assumes the presidency in January. Trump Jr argued that the defense industry benefits from war and seeks to undermine his father's peacemaking efforts.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: No sunrise in this US town for 64 days! Here's why
item.description: The town of Utqiagvik, Alaska, formerly known as Barrow, has entered a 64-day period of polar night, with its last sunrise occurring on November 18. This phenomenon, caused by the Earth's tilt, plunges the town into darkness as the sun remains below the horizon for approximately two months each year.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Iran's supreme leader Khamenei in coma? His office releases picture to end rumours
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: US: 2 shot dead, nine injured in separate shootings in New Orleans
item.description: Two separate shootings disrupted a "second line" parade in New Orleans' St Roch neighborhood, claiming the lives of two individuals and leaving nine others injured. The incidents, occurring 45 minutes apart, transpired along the parade route, marring the traditional celebratory event with violence.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Joe Biden allows Ukraine to use long-range US missiles for first time against Russia
item.description: President Biden has authorized the transfer of long-range ATACMS missiles to Ukraine for use against Russian targets. This decision follows a massive Russian missile and drone attack on Ukrainian civilian infrastructure. Zelenskyy, while condemning the attacks and Russia's collaboration with North Korea, urged the G20 for a decisive response to deter further aggression.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 8 killed as Russia launches one of its fiercest missile and drone attacks at Ukraine's infrastructure
Most complaints exaggerated: Muhammad Yunus denies widespread violence against Hindus in Bangladesh
Trump's defence secretary pick paid an accuser, but denies sex assault
Muhammad Yunus promises polls after reforms
